private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks that are vowels.
Vowel blocks in this scenario are: A, E, I.
I can only interact with blocks that are on the top of a stack, one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the blocks so that they form the target single chain with M on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks that are consonants.
Consonant blocks in this scenario are: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can only interact with blocks that are on the top of a stack, one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to reconfiguring the blocks so that they form the target single chain with M on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations and plans.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that encodes the initial state and the target final chain for a FastDownwards run.

public_information: There are 13 uniquely labeled blocks: I, B, J, K, G, L, F, M, A, C, H, D, E.
Agents may only manipulate blocks that are on the top of a stack and may move one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowel blocks and the other to consonant blocks.
Initial stacks: Stack1 has I on the table, B on I, J on B, L on J, M on L, H on M, D on H, E on D.
Initial stacks: Stack2 has K on the table, G on K, A on G, C on A.
Initial stacks: Stack3 has F on the table.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, and M on the table.
All moves must respect the top-only and single-block-at-a-time constraints.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a specialized agent responsible for analyzing movable vowel blocks and reporting their current top-of-stack accessibility and any constraints you observe.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You can only manipulate vowel blocks. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} to produce a concise report that lists which vowel blocks are currently on top of a stack, which vowel blocks are buried, and any immediate moves you can perform without breaking the top-only one-block-at-a-time rule. Do not emit PDDL; produce a clear machine-readable report suitable for the orchestrator.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a specialized agent responsible for analyzing movable consonant blocks and reporting their current top-of-stack accessibility and any constraints you observe.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You can only manipulate consonant blocks. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} to produce a concise report that lists which consonant blocks are currently on top of a stack, which consonant blocks are buried, and any immediate moves you can perform without breaking the top-only one-block-at-a-time rule. Do not emit PDDL; produce a clear machine-readable report suitable for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent blocksworld PDDL modeling and FastDownwards usage. You must produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that encode the initial state and the target final chain. The produced PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards conventions and must keep agent-specific actions distinct when needed.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the public information {environment->public_information}, the vowel agent report {vowel_report}, and the consonant agent report {consonant_report} and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that achieves the goal: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on the table. Keep the actions of the two agents conceptually distinct in the domain if necessary. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The output should be the final PDDL domain and problem suitable to feed directly to FastDownwards.
